alert.note: Alert for Taos (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 17 at 11:45AM MDT until further notice by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central and northeast New Mexico, including the following counties, in north central New Mexico, Taos. In northeast New Mexico, Mora. This includes the northern section of the Hermit`s Peak Calf Canyon burn scar. * WHEN...Until 145 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1144 AM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.25 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mora, Holman, Cleveland, Chacon, El Turquillo and Guadalupita. - This includes the following highways... State Road 518 between Mile Markers 29 and 44. State Road 121 between Mile Markers 0 and 8. State Road 283 near Mile Marker 13. State Road 434 between Mile Markers 0 and 15. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Runoff from rainfall will cause elevated water levels within vulnerable drainages in and downstream of the Hermit`s Peak Calf Canyon burn area.
